sentences.sentence: Men are struggling by most measures.

What's the solution?Listen to and follow 'Matter of Opinion'Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Stitcher|Amazon MusicAmerican men and boys are struggling ᅳ in education, employment, relationships and mental health.
But just bringing up how to address the “crisis of masculinity” is politically polarized dynamite.
In light of that, is there any hope for solutions?
On this episode of “Matter of Opinion,” trad bros, sports cars and mobsters in therapy.Thoughts?
Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.comor leave us a voice mail message at (212) 556-7440.

We may use excerpts from your message in a future episode.By leaving us a message, you are agreeing to be governed by ourreader submission termsand agreeing that we may use and allow others to use your name, voice and message.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” was produced this week by Sophia Alvarez Boyd, Phoebe Lett and Derek Arthur.
It was edited by Stephanie Joyce and Annie-Rose Strasser.
Mixing by Carole Sabouraud and Pat McCusker.
Original music by Pat McCusker, Sonia Herrero, Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro and Carole Sabouraud.
Fact-checking by Kate Sinclair and Michelle Harris.
Special thanks to Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; photograph by skynesher/Getty Images FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: Men are struggling by most measures. What’s the solution?Listen to and follow ‘Matter of Opinion’Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Stitcher|Amazon MusicAmerican men and boys are struggling — in education, employment, relationships and mental health. But just bringing up how to address the “crisis of masculinity” is politically polarized dynamite. In light of that, is there any hope for solutions? On this episode of “Matter of Opinion,” trad bros, sports cars and mobsters in therapy.Thoughts? Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.comor leave us a voice mail message at (212) 556-7440. We may use excerpts from your message in a future episode.By leaving us a message, you are agreeing to be governed by ourreader submission termsand agreeing that we may use and allow others to use your name, voice and message.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” was produced this week by Sophia Alvarez Boyd, Phoebe Lett and Derek Arthur. It was edited by Stephanie Joyce and Annie-Rose Strasser. Mixing by Carole Sabouraud and Pat McCusker. Original music by Pat McCusker, Sonia Herrero, Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro and Carole Sabouraud. Fact-checking by Kate Sinclair and Michelle Harris. Special thanks to Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.PHOTO:  (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; photograph by skynesher/Getty Images FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)
